messages.messageBody:
Those are from Rurouni Kenshin, the series from which Samurai X is from, but
not Samurai X is self.

<============}xoxoxoxo oxoxoxox{============>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory]: Samurai X Quotes
messages.msgSnippet: The first episode of Rouroni Kenshin, when Kaouro is being harrased by the group of men who begin mocking her desire to teach the use of the sword as a tool of
messages.messageBody:
The first episode of Rouroni Kenshin, when Kaouro is being harrased by
the group of men who begin mocking her desire to teach the use of the
sword as a tool of protection.
Kenshin walks into the dojo and says something to the effect of, "It
is true that the sword and the art of swordsmanship are tools of
death, and what Miss Kaouro says are the sweet and innocent words of
one who has never slain a man. However, I would like it very much to
be the truth one day, that I would."

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Charisse Linsangan
<cha_hogwarts@y...> wrote:
> I remember one episode during the Shimabara Arc but it's kinda silly:
> Yahiko: Next time, let's follow the opposite of Sano's instincs!
> Sano: Maybe I should have left you there to be flatten like a pancake
>
> and there's another one I remember. It was said by Misao and some
men she tried to steal from:
> Men: Hey, what's wrong now? Are you scared? ...You said we can do
it...you know...
> Misao: Oh, I'm scared... you see, i'm still a virgin, hihihi...
> Men: WOE!!! REALLY?!!! Let's see what you got!
> Misao: OK...(takes off her cloak) YEAH! Now give me all the money
you got! Hand it over!
> Men: Forget it. She's a girl.
>
> coeli jimenez <coeli_tensai@y...> wrote:
> there is one quote...it's from the samurai x movie...it goes
something like: "The bluest sky is infinitely high and crystal clear".
this was something Gentatsu told Shigure before they attacked the
Choshu clan (the clan whom Kenshin works for)
>
> Sara Cooper <saracooper22@h...> wrote:I have to write a character
analysis on Kenshin from Samurai X for
> English...uh...today. Does anyone possibly have any quotes from it,
that is
> if anyone actually likes Samurai X. Any help would be greatly
appreciated!
>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory]: Samurai X Quotes
messages.msgSnippet: I remember one episode during the Shimabara Arc but it s kinda silly: Yahiko: Next time, let s follow the opposite of Sano s instincs! Sano: Maybe I should
messages.messageBody:
I remember one episode during the Shimabara Arc but it's kinda silly:
Yahiko: Next time, let's follow the opposite of Sano's instincs!
Sano: Maybe I should have left you there to be flatten like a pancake

and there's another one I remember. It was said by Misao and some men she tried to steal from:
Men: Hey, what's wrong now? Are you scared? ...You said we can do it...you know...
Misao: Oh, I'm scared... you see, i'm still a virgin, hihihi...
Men: WOE!!! REALLY?!!! Let's see what you got!
Misao: OK...(takes off her cloak) YEAH! Now give me all the money you got! Hand it over!
Men: Forget it. She's a girl.

coeli jimenez <coeli_tensai@...> wrote:
there is one quote...it's from the samurai x movie...it goes something like: "The bluest sky is infinitely high and crystal clear". this was something Gentatsu told Shigure before they attacked the Choshu clan (the clan whom Kenshin works for)

Sara Cooper <saracooper22@...> wrote:I have to write a character analysis on Kenshin from Samurai X for
English...uh...today. Does anyone possibly have any quotes from it, that is
if anyone actually likes Samurai X. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

there is one quote...it's from the samurai x movie...it goes something like: "The bluest sky is infinitely high and crystal clear". this was something Gentatsu told Shigure before they attacked the Choshu clan (the clan whom Kenshin works for)

English...uh...today. Does anyone possibly have any quotes from it, that is
if anyone actually likes Samurai X. Any help would be greatly appreciated!
